fields.headline: Jazz preview
fields.bodyText: American saxophonist Tim Berne's bands may not threaten to scorch the paint off the walls quite the way that John Zorn's do, but his music's tight logic, general avoidance of legato melody, occasional electronics impressionism and Coltranesque sax wails is no easy ride. To mark the launch of his band Big Satan's new Live In Cognito album, Berne, bassist Drew Gress and drummer Tom Rainey tour the UK; the three-night run at London's Vortex includes an appearance by guitarist Marc Ducret on Monday and Tuesday, with the latter show a double-header for two powerful Berne bands - Paraphrase in the first half, Big Satan in the second. Artists Steve Byram and Jonathan Rosen also furnish works to accompany the music. · CBSO Centre, Birmingham, Sat 24; Vortex, N16, Sun 25 to Tue 27; The Wardrobe, Leeds, Wed 28; Jazz Centre @ The Lot, Edinburgh, Thu 29; Lighthouse, Poole, Fri 30
